description: Two individual online tests (90 minutes each) with multiple-choice, true/false, and short answer questions covering course material from the first and second halves of the term. Held in Weeks 4 and 9.

Group project (3-4 members) delivering a 4-minute oral presentation pitching a biotechnology product to attract venture capital investment. Covers unmet need, market size, intellectual property, and business model. Due in Week 10.

Individual assignments split into two parts: Part 1 (SWOT analysis of a biotechnology product, due Week 3) and Part 2 (4-page investment thesis report on a selected company, due Week 7). Focuses on critical evaluation and scientific communication.

Individual creation of a one-page A4 brochure (front and back) explaining a scientific discovery to high school students. Emphasizes background, unmet need, solution, and data visualization. Due in Week 5.
